content.description: Solid starting ledge to two good holds sticking out of the wall.  Your next options include a dirty left sloper with some slightly better grip further back, and/or a chossy right pinch.  There is a thin but solid layback crack in the roof, and a good ledge with a struggly top out.
content.location: Just to the left of the waterfall, across from the rope swing

content.description: Gain the first ledge using a solid outcropping of rock.  good pockets to the next ledge, then topout
content.protection: Water landing, about 5-6 feet depth during rainy season
content.location: A few yards downstream (left) of the ropeswing.

content.description: Marked by solid starting holds and a good 3 finger pocket.  Every hold after the 3 finger pocket should be treated with suspicion, especially the stuff on the top-out shelf which could potentially come off in large chunks.  Water levels vary, but the landing zone is about 6-7 feet deep during rainy season.
content.location: A little downstream from the rope swing tree

content.description: When there's enough water in the creek bed, some of the cliffs along the creek in St. Edward's Park are climbable. The trick is finding faces that have deep enough water below AND decent rock quality.  Every hold should be treated with suspicion at first, and topping out can get especially dirty and sketchy, so use your best judgement if you climb here!
